dfischer.utils

Class HttpSocketPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.HttpSocketPool

  • public class HttpSocketPool
extends java.lang.Object
    TCP/IP connection pool for HTTP 1.1 support (keep-alive).
    See Also:
    HttpSocketPoolItem, HttpTestURL

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_FAST
      Use a fast but very weak (non-)secure random generator for SSL handshakes.
      static int SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_IAIK_DEFAULT
      Use the IAIK default random generator for SSL handshakes (SHA256PRNG-FIPS).
      static int SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_JAVA_DEFAULT
      Use the default Java random generator for SSL handshakes (secure, but non-recommended because it may be very slow).

      void closeFreeSockets(int maxKeepAliveTime)
      Close all free sockets in the pool which are older than a specified time.
      void closeOutdatedSockets(int maxTime)
      Close and remove outdated sockets from the pool - regardless if they are currently used or not.
      void closePool()
      Clear the whole connection pool.
      void disableSslLog()
      Disable the SSL handshake log (if it was previously enabled).
      void dumpPool()
      Supports debugging - dumps all connections of the pool to standard output.
      void enableSslLog()
      Enables additionally the SSL handshake log (if socket pool debugging is already enabled by setlogVectorObject(Object logVectorObject)).

      Get whether to allow SSL legacy renegotiation.

      Creates a new network connection that supports TLS SNI and adds it to the pool.

      Deprecated. 
      This method does not support the HttpTestURLSetExecutionStepInterface. Creates a new network connection that supports TLS SNI and adds it to the pool.
      HttpSocketPoolItem getNewSocket(java.lang.String host, java.lang.String sniServerName, int port, boolean useSSL, NextProxyConfig nextSSLproxyConfig, int trialCount, HttpTestURLSetExecutionStepInterface setExecutionStepInstance)
      Creates a new network connection that supports TLS SNI and adds it to the pool.
      int getReuseCount()
      Get the total number of reused network connections.
      HttpSocketPoolItem getSocketFromPool(java.lang.String host, int port, boolean useSSL, NextProxyConfig nextSSLproxyConfig)
      Deprecated. 
      This method does not support TLS SNI. . Gets a free, already used network connection from the pool. If no free connection was found a new connection will be created and added to the pool. CAUTION: if the http I/O fails because the socket is (later) closed by the web server YOU MUST call as next getNewSocket() !!!
      HttpSocketPoolItem getSocketFromPool(java.lang.String host, java.lang.String sniServerName, int port, boolean useSSL, NextProxyConfig nextSSLproxyConfig)
      Deprecated. 
      This method does not support the HttpTestURLSetExecutionStepInterface. Gets a free, already used network connection from the pool that supports TLS SNI. If no free connection was found a new connection will be created and added to the pool. CAUTION: if the http I/O fails because the socket is (later) closed by the web server YOU MUST call as next getNewSocket() !!!

        public static final int SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_JAVA_DEFAULT
        Use the default Java random generator for SSL handshakes (secure, but non-recommended because it may be very slow).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final int SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_IAIK_DEFAULT
        Use the IAIK default random generator for SSL handshakes (SHA256PRNG-FIPS).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_FAST

        public static final int SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_FAST
        Use a fast but very weak (non-)secure random generator for SSL handshakes. Note: this random generator will never block on Linux-like machines.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpSocketPool

        public HttpSocketPool(HttpLoadTest httpLoadTest,
              java.lang.String sslProtocolVersion,
              java.lang.Object sslSessionCache,
              SSLSessionCacheStatistic sslSessionCacheStatistic,
              boolean applyHttpsCompatibilityBugfix)
        Creates a new connection pool.
        Parameters:
        httpLoadTest - reference to the load test program
        sslProtocolVersion - applied ssl protocol version. Use "all" for v3/tls/tls11/tls12 or one of the following options: "v2", "v3", "tls", "tls11", "tls12"
        sslSessionCache - reference to the ssl session cache, or null = ssl session cache disabled
        sslSessionCacheStatistic - reference to the ssl session cache statistic, or null = ssl session cache statistic disabled
        applyHttpsCompatibilityBugfix - if true, apply several SSL/HTTPS compatibility bugfixes
        Since:
        V5.4-F
        See Also:
        SSLInit.getNewSslSessionCache(int), SSLSessionCacheStatistic

      • HttpSocketPool

    • Method Detail

      • setSslVersion

        public void setSslVersion(java.lang.String sslProtocolVersion)
        Allows to set a specific SSL protocol version.
        Parameters:
        sslProtocolVersion - possible values are "v2", "v3" "tls" "tls11" and "tls12"

      • setSoTimeout

        public void setSoTimeout(int soTimeout)
        Set the socket read timeout for all new created sockets of the pool. Note: The default socket read timeout of the pool is infinite if this method is never called.
        Parameters:
        soTimeout - the socked read timeout in seconds, 0 = no timeout (infinite)

      • getSoTimeout

        public int getSoTimeout()
        Get the socket read timeout for all new created sockets of the pool.
        Returns:
        the socked read timeout in seconds, 0 = no timeout (infinite)

      • setConnectTimeout

        public void setConnectTimeout(int connectTimeout)
        Set the socket connect timeout for all new created sockets of the pool. Note: The default socket connect timeout of the pool is the same value as the socket read timeout.
        Parameters:
        connectTimeout - the socket connect timeout in seconds, 0 = same as the socket read timeout
        Since:
        V5.4-R
        See Also:
        setSoTimeout(int)

      • getConnectTimeout

        public int getConnectTimeout()
        Get the socket connect timeout for all new created sockets of the pool.
        Returns:
        the socket connect timeout in seconds, 0 = same as the socket read timeout
        Since:
        V5.4-R
        See Also:
        getSoTimeout()

      • setAllowLegacyRenegotiation

        public void setAllowLegacyRenegotiation(boolean allowLegacyRenegotiation)
        Set whether to allow SSL legacy renegotiation. If this flag is set to true (= default value), renegotiation without using the Renegotiation Indication Extension extension (RFC 5746) is allowed.
        Parameters:
        allowLegacyRenegotiation - whether to allow legacy renegotiation or not (default: true; legacy renegotiation is allowed)

      • getAllowLegacyRenegotiation

        public boolean getAllowLegacyRenegotiation()
        Get whether to allow SSL legacy renegotiation.
        Returns:
        true if legacy renegotiation is allowed (default), or false if legacy renegotiation is not allowed

      • setSupportEllipticCurves

        public void setSupportEllipticCurves(boolean supportEllipticCurves)
        Set whether to support elliptic curve cryptography (ECC). If this flag is set to true ECC is supported.
        Parameters:
        supportEllipticCurves - whether to support ECC or not (default: false; ECC is not supported)

      • getSupportEllipticCurves

        public boolean getSupportEllipticCurves()
        Get whether to support elliptic curve cryptography (ECC).
        Returns:
        true if ECC is supported, or false if ECC is not supported (default)

      • setSniCritical

        public void setSniCritical(boolean isCritical)
        Set TLS SNI as critical (default: not critical). For further information about SNI (Server Name Indication) see RFC 3546.
        Parameters:
        isCritical - true = now critical

      • isSniCritical

        public boolean isSniCritical()
        Get if TLS SNI is configured as critical. For further information about SNI (Server Name Indication) see RFC 3546.
        Returns:
        true if TLS SNI is configured as critical

      • setHintUseSNI

        public void setHintUseSNI(boolean hintUseSNI)
        Set a hint if TLS SNI should be used by the caller of this pool methods. Note that this method set only a flag inside the pool. The real logic whether SNI is applied or not depends only on the fact if the parameter "sniServerName" is passed or not when getting a socket from the pool.
        Parameters:
        hintUseSNI -
        See Also:
        isHintUseSNI()

      • isHintUseSNI

        public boolean isHintUseSNI()
        Get a hint if TLS SNI should be used by the caller of this pool methods
        Returns:
        true = TLS SNI should be used.

      • usesTlsSessionTickets

        public boolean usesTlsSessionTickets()
        Get if TLS connection can use Session Tickets.
        Returns:
        true = Session Tickets can be used with TLS.

      • setUseTlsSessionTickets

        public void setUseTlsSessionTickets(boolean useTlsSessionTickets)
        Set if Session Tickets can be used with TLS
        Parameters:
        useTlsSessionTickets - true = Set to use Session Tickets with TLS

      • sslHandshakeRandomGeneratorTypeToString

        public static java.lang.String sslHandshakeRandomGeneratorTypeToString(int sslHandshakeRandomGeneratorType)
        Get the string representation of the random generator type used for SSL handshakes
        Parameters:
        sslHandshakeRandomGeneratorType - the type of the random generator used for SSL handshakes
        Returns:
        the string representation of the random generator type used for SSL handshakes. This is either "SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_JAVA_DEFAULT" or "SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_IAIK_DEFAULT" or "SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_FAST".
        See Also:
        SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_JAVA_DEFAULT, SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_IAIK_DEFAULT, SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_FAST

      • getSslHandshakeRandomGeneratorTypeFromString

        public static int getSslHandshakeRandomGeneratorTypeFromString(java.lang.String s)
        Get the type of the random generator used for SSL handshakes from its string representation
        Parameters:
        s - the string representation of the type of the random generator used for SSL handshakes. This can be either "SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_JAVA_DEFAULT" or "SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_IAIK_DEFAULT" or "SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_FAST". Note: strings containing lower case chars are also accepted.
        Returns:
        the type of the random generator used for SSL handshakes
        See Also:
        SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_JAVA_DEFAULT, SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_IAIK_DEFAULT, SSL_HANDSHAKE_RANDOM_GENERATOR_TYPE_FAST

        public void enableSslLog()

        public void disableSslLog()

      • getSocketFromPool

        public HttpSocketPoolItem getSocketFromPool(java.lang.String host,
                                   int port,
                                   boolean useSSL,
                                   NextProxyConfig nextSSLproxyConfig)
                                     throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                            java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. This method does not support TLS SNI. . Gets a free, already used network connection from the pool. If no free connection was found a new connection will be created and added to the pool. CAUTION: if the http I/O fails because the socket is (later) closed by the web server YOU MUST call as next getNewSocket() !!!
        Parameters:
        host - remote (target) host - DNS name or IP address
        port - remote (target) port
        useSSL - if true: use HTTPS protocol
        nextSSLproxyConfig - connection data to the next https proxy server or null if no https proxy server is used.
        Returns:
        a free connection from the pool
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        getNewSocket(java.lang.String, int, boolean, dfischer.utils.NextProxyConfig)

      • getSocketFromPool

        public HttpSocketPoolItem getSocketFromPool(java.lang.String host,
                                   java.lang.String sniServerName,
                                   int port,
                                   boolean useSSL,
                                   NextProxyConfig nextSSLproxyConfig)
                                     throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                            java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. This method does not support the HttpTestURLSetExecutionStepInterface. Gets a free, already used network connection from the pool that supports TLS SNI. If no free connection was found a new connection will be created and added to the pool. CAUTION: if the http I/O fails because the socket is (later) closed by the web server YOU MUST call as next getNewSocket() !!!
        Parameters:
        host - remote (target) host - DNS name or IP address
        sniServerName - the TLS/SNI DNS host name of the target server (optional, can be null). If this parameter is not null then SNI (Server Name Indication) is enabled for TLS connections as described in RFC 3546
        port - remote (target) port
        useSSL - if true: use HTTPS protocol
        nextSSLproxyConfig - connection data to the next https proxy server or null if no https proxy server is used.
        Returns:
        a free connection from the pool
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        getNewSocket(java.lang.String, int, boolean, dfischer.utils.NextProxyConfig)

      • getSocketFromPool

        public HttpSocketPoolItem getSocketFromPool(java.lang.String host,
                                   java.lang.String sniServerName,
                                   int port,
                                   boolean useSSL,
                                   NextProxyConfig nextSSLproxyConfig,
                                   HttpTestURLSetExecutionStepInterface setExecutionStepInstance)
                                     throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                            java.io.IOException
        Gets a free, already used network connection from the pool that supports TLS SNI. If no free connection was found a new connection will be created and added to the pool. CAUTION: if the http I/O fails because the socket is (later) closed by the web server YOU MUST call as next getNewSocket() !!!
        Parameters:
        host - remote (target) host - DNS name or IP address
        sniServerName - the TLS/SNI DNS host name of the target server (optional, can be null). If this parameter is not null then SNI (Server Name Indication) is enabled for TLS connections as described in RFC 3546
        port - remote (target) port
        useSSL - if true: use HTTPS protocol
        nextSSLproxyConfig - connection data to the next https proxy server or null if no https proxy server is used.
        setExecutionStepInstance - optional, can be null. Passed if the caller supports the HttpTestURLSetExecutionStepInterface
        Returns:
        a free connection from the pool
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        getNewSocket(java.lang.String, int, boolean, dfischer.utils.NextProxyConfig)

      • getNewSocket

        public HttpSocketPoolItem getNewSocket(java.lang.String host,
                              int port,
                              boolean useSSL,
                              NextProxyConfig nextSSLproxyConfig)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. This method does not support TLS SNI. Creates a new network connection and adds it to the pool.
        Parameters:
        host - remote (target) host - DNS name or IP address
        port - remote (target) port
        useSSL - if true: use HTTPS protocol
        nextSSLproxyConfig - connection data to the next https proxy server or null if no https proxy server is used.
        Returns:
        a free connection from the pool
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getNewSocket

        public HttpSocketPoolItem getNewSocket(java.lang.String host,
                              java.lang.String sniServerName,
                              int port,
                              boolean useSSL,
                              NextProxyConfig nextSSLproxyConfig)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new network connection that supports TLS SNI and adds it to the pool.
        Parameters:
        host - remote (target) host - DNS name or IP address
        sniServerName - the TLS/SNI DNS host name of the target server (optional, can be null). If this parameter is not null then SNI (Server Name Indication) is enabled for TLS connections as described in RFC 3546
        port - remote (target) port
        useSSL - if true: use HTTPS protocol
        nextSSLproxyConfig - connection data to the next https proxy server or null if no https proxy server is used.
        Returns:
        a free connection from the pool
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getNewSocket

        public HttpSocketPoolItem getNewSocket(java.lang.String host,
                              int port,
                              boolean useSSL,
                              NextProxyConfig nextSSLproxyConfig,
                              int trialCount)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. This method does not support TLS SNI. Creates a new network connection and adds it to the pool.
        Parameters:
        host - remote (target) host - DNS name or IP address
        port - remote (target) port
        useSSL - if true: use HTTPS protocol
        nextSSLproxyConfig - connection data to the next https proxy server or null if no https proxy server is used.
        trialCount - number of trials to open the network connection
        Returns:
        a free connection from the pool
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getNewSocket

        public HttpSocketPoolItem getNewSocket(java.lang.String host,
                              java.lang.String sniServerName,
                              int port,
                              boolean useSSL,
                              NextProxyConfig nextSSLproxyConfig,
                              int trialCount)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. This method does not support the HttpTestURLSetExecutionStepInterface. Creates a new network connection that supports TLS SNI and adds it to the pool.
        Parameters:
        host - remote (target) host - DNS name or IP address
        sniServerName - the TLS/SNI DNS host name of the target server (optional, can be null). If this parameter is not null then SNI (Server Name Indication) is enabled for TLS connections as described in RFC 3546
        port - remote (target) port
        useSSL - if true: use HTTPS protocol
        nextSSLproxyConfig - connection data to the next https proxy server or null if no https proxy server is used.
        trialCount - number of trials to open the network connection
        Returns:
        a free connection from the pool
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getNewSocket

        public HttpSocketPoolItem getNewSocket(java.lang.String host,
                              java.lang.String sniServerName,
                              int port,
                              boolean useSSL,
                              NextProxyConfig nextSSLproxyConfig,
                              HttpTestURLSetExecutionStepInterface setExecutionStepInstance)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new network connection that supports TLS SNI and adds it to the pool.
        Parameters:
        host - remote (target) host - DNS name or IP address
        sniServerName - the TLS/SNI DNS host name of the target server (optional, can be null). If this parameter is not null then SNI (Server Name Indication) is enabled for TLS connections as described in RFC 3546
        port - remote (target) port
        useSSL - if true: use HTTPS protocol
        nextSSLproxyConfig - connection data to the next https proxy server or null if no https proxy server is used.
        setExecutionStepInstance - optional, can be null. Passed if the caller supports the HttpTestURLSetExecutionStepInterface
        Returns:
        a free connection from the pool
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getNewSocket

        public HttpSocketPoolItem getNewSocket(java.lang.String host,
                              java.lang.String sniServerName,
                              int port,
                              boolean useSSL,
                              NextProxyConfig nextSSLproxyConfig,
                              int trialCount,
                              HttpTestURLSetExecutionStepInterface setExecutionStepInstance)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new network connection that supports TLS SNI and adds it to the pool.
        Parameters:
        host - remote (target) host - DNS name or IP address
        sniServerName - the TLS/SNI DNS host name of the target server (optional, can be null). If this parameter is not null then SNI (Server Name Indication) is enabled for TLS connections as described in RFC 3546
        port - remote (target) port
        useSSL - if true: use HTTPS protocol
        nextSSLproxyConfig - connection data to the next https proxy server or null if no https proxy server is used.
        trialCount - number of trials to open the network connection
        setExecutionStepInstance - optional, can be null. Passed if the caller supports the HttpTestURLSetExecutionStepInterface
        Returns:
        a free connection from the pool
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setNewSslSessionCache

        public void setNewSslSessionCache(java.lang.Object sslSessionCache)
        Sets a new SSL session cache.
        Parameters:
        sslSessionCache - reference to the ssl session cache

      • returnSocketToPool

        public void returnSocketToPool(HttpSocketPoolItem item,
                      boolean close)
        Return a used connection to the pool. It is marked as free/reusable if close == false.
        Parameters:
        item - the returned connection
        close - if true: close and destroy the connection. Remove it from pool.

      • markFailedReuse

        public void markFailedReuse()
        Correct (only) the pool statistic if a free connection was "dead".

      • closeFreeSockets

        public void closeFreeSockets(int maxKeepAliveTime)
        Close all free sockets in the pool which are older than a specified time.
        Parameters:
        maxKeepAliveTime - max. time in seconds. All free sockets that are older are closed and removed from the pool, you can pass also a value of -1 to close all unused free sockets

      • closeOutdatedSockets

        public void closeOutdatedSockets(int maxTime)
        Close and remove outdated sockets from the pool - regardless if they are currently used or not.
        Parameters:
        maxTime - max. time in seconds. All sockets that are older are closed and removed from the pool

      • closePool

        public void closePool()
        Clear the whole connection pool. Closes all open network connections.

      • getAllPoolItems

        public HttpSocketPoolItem[] getAllPoolItems()
        Get all network connections of the pool.
        Returns:
        all network connections of the pool

      • getSSLVersion

        public java.lang.String getSSLVersion()
        Get the SSL version(s) which the pool uses.
        Returns:
        "all", "tls12", "tls11", "tls", "v3" or "v2"

      • getCreateCount

        public int getCreateCount()
        Get the total number of new created network connections. Used for statistic.

      • getReuseCount

        public int getReuseCount()
        Get the total number of reused network connections. Used for statistic.

      • dumpPool

        public void dumpPool()
        Supports debugging - dumps all connections of the pool to standard output.
